roleset.name: intention, purpose

roles.note: You should be able to replace 'mean' with 'intend' for this sense.

example.name: with beneficiary
example.text: The letter was meant for him

roleset.note: Frames file for 'mean' based on survey of initial sentences of big corpus. Member of VN class intend-61.2-1.

roleset.name: signaling or signifying

example.name: with a seperate agent and conveyer of meaning
example.text: What T- do you mean by that *-1

example.name: again, seperate agent and conveyer
example.text: I don't mean anything by that

example.name: non-agentive, non-volitional conveyer of meaning
example.text: A wagging tail means the dog is happy.

example.name: Volitional and intentional = agent
example.text: I mean that you loo silly in that hat.
example.arg: that you look silly in that hat.

roleset.note: Split from mean.01, which was unable to caputer conveyance of meaning. Member of VN class conjecture-29.5-1.

example.name: resulted in
example.text: Huge gains by her students in 1987 and 1988 meant a total of $5000 in bonuses over two years.
example.arg: Huge gains by her students in 1987 and 1988
a total of $5000 in bonuses over two years.

example.name: this means that
example.text: The leeway that Sea Containers has means that Temple would have to substantially increase their bid.
example.arg: that Temple would have to substantially increase their bid.

example.name: with arg 3
example.text: what-1 a Lien victory means T-1 for the New Party
